decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent through a combination of direct burn spells and aggressive creatures. By utilizing efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning, as well as powerful creatures like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Goblin Guide, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early on and finish them off before they can stabilize. Additionally, cards like Sulfuric Vortex and Chandra's Incinerator provide additional sources of damage to help seal the win.

This deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient spells to control the opponent's board while also putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures. The goal is to quickly disrupt the opponent's game plan with counter spells like Force of Will and Daze, while also dealing damage with creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf. The inclusion of powerful cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns adds versatility to the deck, allowing for additional disruption and threats. With a strong mana base and card draw spells, this deck aims to maintain tempo and outpace the opponent.

The main objective of this deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent by casting efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf, Hooting Mandrills, and Delver of Secrets. By utilizing cheap counterspells like Force of Will, Daze, and Force of Negation, the deck aims to protect its creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck leverages card draw and manipulation tools like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain to maintain consistency and find key pieces. Finally, the inclusion of disruptive cards like Wasteland and Oko, Thief of Crowns further solidifies the deck's aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents with disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Tocatli Honor Guard while using Aether Vial to sneak them onto the battlefield quickly. It also utilizes powerful combo pieces like Phyrexian Dreadnought and Heliod, Sun-Crowned to quickly close out games. The deck's mana denial plan includes cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port to slow down opponents, while cards like Spirit of the Labyrinth and Hushbringer provide additional hate against certain strategies. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure while disrupting opponent's game plan.

The deck revolves around assembling the Dark Depths combo as quickly as possible using cards like Thespian's Stage, Crop Rotation, and Vampire Hexmage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek while also providing card advantage with Dark Confidant. The deck also includes mana acceleration with cards like Elvish Spirit Guide and aims to protect its combo pieces with cards like Pithing Needle and Abrupt Decay. Overall, the deck is focused on efficiently executing the Dark Depths combo while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

This Legacy Aggro deck focuses on disrupting opponents' strategies with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Sanctum Prelate while efficiently deploying threats such as Stoneforge Mystic and Flickerwisp. The deck also utilizes Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and protect them with Mother of Runes. Phyrexian Revoker can shut down key abilities, while Rishadan Port and Wasteland disrupt opponents' mana bases. The deck aims to apply pressure early and control the board with a mix of disruptive creatures and equipment.

This deck focuses on using the Doomsday combo to win the game quickly and efficiently. It relies heavily on cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Predict to set up the perfect hand for a successful Doomsday resolution. The goal is to stack the deck in such a way that Thassa's Oracle can be played to win the game on the spot. The deck includes various protection spells and cantrips to ensure the combo goes off smoothly while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on generating as much mana as possible through the use of Elves and Gaea's Cradle, leading to explosive plays with cards like Natural Order and Green Sun's Zenith to search for key combo pieces like Craterhoof Behemoth. The deck also includes powerful draw spells like Glimpse of Nature to maintain card advantage and assemble the combo quickly. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a large board of Elves and finish the game with a massive Craterhoof Behemoth or overwhelming card advantage from Regal Force.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill the opponent's library, while using cards like Goblin Engineer and Goblin Welder to tutor and recur key pieces. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Blood Moon and Karn, the Great Creator to disrupt the opponent's mana base and shut down key artifacts. Seasoned Pyromancer and Wurmcoil Engine provide additional value and creature threats. Overall, this deck aims to control the game through powerful combos and disruption.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo of Grindstone and Painter's Servant to mill the opponent's entire deck. It includes cards like Goblin Engineer and Goblin Welder to tutor and recur combo pieces, while also running disruption like Pyroblast and Ethersworn Canonist to control the game. The deck aims to quickly and efficiently set up the combo while protecting it from opposing threats, ultimately winning the game through a devastating mill effect.

The deck aims to quickly get out powerful creatures such as Emrakul and Uro onto the battlefield by using the card Show and Tell. It also has various control elements like Stifle and Veil of Summer to protect its game plan. The deck is designed to disrupt the opponent with counterspells like Force of Will while also being able to generate card advantage with Brainstorm and Ponder. By combining a powerful combo with control and card advantage, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly.

The deck focuses on utilizing various control elements such as counterspells, removal, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also generating card advantage and value through cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Oko, Thief of Crowns. It also utilizes the graveyard as a resource with cards like Life from the Loam and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent while controlling the game through various means, ultimately aiming to grind out a win through attrition and resource management.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly deploy aggressive threats like True-Name Nemesis, Sprite Dragon, and Delver of Secrets while disrupting the opponent's game plan with countermagic like Force of Will, Force of Negation, and Spell Pierce. The deck aims to control the game through tempo plays, using cards like Daze to keep opponents off-balance while applying pressure with cheap and efficient creatures. The mana base is optimized for consistency, with a focus on fetching important dual lands like Volcanic Island and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base.
